The tenor solo wat repdertd with gocd eicot. by Mr. Parris, who bas a fipe tenor voice. The Evensong ic'oction "Nightfall" from Rath," by the same composer, was excellently roog. div.head: Bulletin De La Bourse
div.p: (Auiourd' hui à midi et demie)

Anjourd'hui, dornier jour de la liquidation, une ronction partielle s'est produite à l'occasion des ventes forobes qui ont eu lien ; la baisse du coton américain dans lequel des égyptions se trouvont intéressés a également influencé les Tondeurs.

La National Bank ba0nse de 37 1/16 à 27 8/8, la Casan di Sconto de 249 et 237 à 943 1/4 et 238 1/2, la Banque d'Athènes de 147 1/4 | 147 1/9, tandis que le Coraptoir réactionne do 7 8/16 at do 6 16/16 1 1/8 et 6 7/8 l'action et de 63 . 52 1/2 la part de fondateur, l'Agricolé do 9 85/32 1 9 3/4, l'Obligation to vello Crédit Foncier de 273 1871, le Crédit Pranco Egyptien de * 5/8 6 9/16, la Banque d'Ociont de 134 à 133 1/2

De 17 0/16 la Daïrs fléchit à 17 5/16, la Delta Land de 4 7/39 a 4 3/3?, la Building Lands de 4 31/32 à 4 15/16 et l'Union Foncière de 6 9/16 à 6 1/2, pendant que l'Urbaine s'avance de 6 5/8 à 6 11/16. · La Dolts Ligbt gagao 1/16 12 1/16 et la Salt and Soda 6 pence à 95/3 ; les Cotton Mills recalent de 7/9 & 7/3; l'Anglo-American Nilo progresse de 5 18/16 4 6 15/16, tandis que los Nopgovich Hotels perdent 1/8 · 18 5/10; los Saoreries monteot da 26 38 1/8, et l'Ordinary Khedivial Mail de 98/9 à 89/9.
L'animation porté spécialement sur la Natioan Baok, la Salt and Sods, la Cassa di Soonto, la Delta Land, les Estates et le Comptoir.

Parmi les Societest qui vont etre lances en Egypts an cours de cetter saison, se trouve une banque de report an capital de *200,000 en actions de *1 chaque. Le succes obtenu par le Comptoir Financier et Commercial d'Egypte a ete tel at a repondu a de si grands besoins qu'il nest pas etonnant de voir d antres Societes embrasser le meme champ d operations. Le nouvelle banque sera lancee comme Compagnie egyptienne sous les suspices de capitalistes anglale. Le capital est deja integralement sousorit
Le Credit Lyonnais a rec matin par le bateau du Lloyd Austrichien "Habsburg" 60 caisses de *5,000 et 6 caisses contenant ensemble *20,000, soit en tont *320,000.

La Corporation des agents de change du Claire a ouvert an oencoure entre architectes de tostes nationalites pour la presentation d un prejet de palais destine a la Bourse du Caire. L premiere condition du cashier des charges poste que tous les projets doiveut etre presentes an Caire, a la Corporation des agents de ohange da Caire, avant le 31 October. U vais axemple que caui que donneraient les agents de change en se muttant volontairement du cote de l arbitraire

div.head: Circulaire H. De Vries et Boutigny
div.p: Notes Et Critiques
Le Caire, November 3.

Le tanx de l eacompte libre a Londres a eleve bier d 1/8 a 6%. An Stock Exchange le consolide anglais n en a pas moin hause de 1/8 a 1/2. L Unifiee a e cotee 102 1/2, ex-coupon. La National Bank a gagne 1/8 a 27 1/2, la Daira 1/4 a 17 3/8 et la Delta Light 1/8 a 12 1/8. L Agricole est demeuree inchangee a 9 7/8.
A Paris, l sotion Credit Foncier Egyptian eat renesignee en hausse de 3 tranos a 785. La Banque d' Athenes a progresse a 147. L Emprunt russes 1906 a passe de 85 10 a 85 60.

loi, le marché de s'est pas trop laissé in floevoer par la bau888 da tax de l'escompte libre à Londres ; ita compris que o'est là on effet transitoire de la oberté des reports à la liqaida Mion te fin de mois. Aussi bien la ten danos S'a pas été mauvaise et une certaine tarmeté prédominé, malgré tout, sar une bonne partie de la oote.

A la vérité, les affaires dat été, dans l'ensemble, plotot restreintes, ce qui est le résul. tst datorel da fait que la liquidation de sera complètement terminée que dans les premiers jours de l semaine prochaine.

Dans le compartiment des Banques, la National, on bonne tendance, « avangé 21 7/16-1/2. L'Agricole a faiblis 9 8/4. La Couna 'di Soon to progressé à 239-240. La Barqše d'Athènes est revenue à 145. Le omptoir Pipangier s'est inscrit à 71/8-8/18 l'action ancienne er 6 7/8 la nouvelle ; la part de fondateur atteint 88. Ls Bar que d'Abyssinie s'est alourdie à 5 9/16-3/8,
Le Crédit Ponciera rétrogradé à 783-784 et Ja Daira Sapieb 17 8/8-7/16. La Bébéra. cloturé 44-44 1/2. VUnion Foncière a été offerte & 6 5/8. .
L'Immobilières résotiuncé à 384.Bien tenus, les Improvements ont gagné 1/8 * 6 9/16.

L'action Expre 8 Nile a été l'objet d'ape bonne dem sode à 4 3/16. L'Anglo-American Nile s'est consolidé à 5 15/16. Les Frigorifi. q908 ont perda 1'16 à 4 11/16. L'action Bras serie des Pyramides a mo'li à 188 et la part de dividende à 78. Lei Automobiles ont recalé à 6 1/8 3/16

Dans le gronpe des valeurs bo'elières, les Nongovich ont été éobapgés a 18 5/16-3/8. Les kryptian ont réactionné à 7 5,8. Las Upper Egypt ont été soutenus & 5 9/16. Les National ont fléchi . 41/:6/8 et leur part de fondo tear * 76.

Parmi les petites valegre, la Delta Lania été ramenés à 4 1/8 8/16 et les Hooker & 1 1/8. Les Betates ont été, à un moment donné, largement ramassés à 2 1/4 poor fioir à 2 3/16-1/4; leor part de fondateur s'est alourdie à 15 15 1/8 Les Salt and Sada ont bénéficié de plus d'un sbelliog à 25 sh. 3. La Kbedivial Mail a progressé à 38 sh. 9 et log Cons trccions à 1 5/8-11/16. Les New Exyptias ont clôturé a 33 sh. 3. Les Cotton Mills, tortement demandés, ont atteint 8 sh. four terminer offerts à oe prix.
Les rumeurs répandues récemment au sujet d'an projet de fusion entre la Compagnie lmmol i ière d'Egypte et la Compagnie Agricole da Nil n'ont éé encore ni oonfirmées, ni démentier.

Bien qu'on ne sacbe guère sur quelles bases cette fusion pourrait ê-re faite, on prétend néanmoins qne le proj t rencontrerait une vivo opposition de la part d'on puissant groope d'actionnaires de la Compagnie Immobilière et même d'une partie de Conseil d'administration de cette soiété.

Oo ne tardera pas, apparemment, à être édifié à cet égard. Ea attendant, on annonce d'Anvers (-iège social de la Compagoie Agricole do Nil) qu'il est question d'ane proobaine émis ion de 5 milions de franos d'obligations pour accroître les ressources de la Société.
Soivant des informations d'Alexandrie, il se confirme que l'émission de la Sidi Salem Estates of Egypt Co. serait lieu dans la seconde quinz sine da mois courant.

On sait que cette société, constitoée à Londres le 25 Juin dernier, au capital de £440.395,5 sh., représenté par 110t.000 actione de £! et 7.725 parts de fondateur à 1 h., a acheté à la Société anonyme du Béhéra le domaine de Sidi Salom d'une s ipe fi sie de 14.00 ) fed dans, à raison d'environ £40 le teddan.

Aiosi qu on l a deja annoace il sera pare il, alloue aux setionnaires de la Bebera un droit de preference lors de la repartition de la Sidi Salem Estates Co., comma cela avait ete fait lors de l emission de l'Union Foneirere

Pressage et Depots sont prevenus que l'assemblee generale ordinaire du 29 Octobre dernier a fixe les intereis et le didende poor l'exercice 1905-1906 a 10% oit a par action. Un acompte de *0.12 ayant ete reparti en Mars dernier, le solde, soit *1.8 sh par action sera paye a partir du 5 novembre coursnt par la Ba que Imperiale Ottomane contre remise du coupon No. 16.

div.head: Telegrams
div.p: New York Governorship
Epithetic Electoral Campaign
Roosevelt Stigmatizes Hearst

The electional campaign for the Governor ship of New York sorpasses all previous elections in America for passion and vehemence. Epitheto of "liar," "eneak," blackguard," "row. dy." ato., eto., are constantly exchanged.

President Roosevelt, who is obable to per sonally participate, has commissioned Mr. Root to declare publicly that Mr. Hearst's election would bring injury and disoredit to honest labour and bonest capital.

Mr. Root denonpoed Mr. Hearst as a deliberate demagogue, an exploiter of sensationalism, an apologist for the murder of President Mac Kinley, an opstirrer of useless discontent. After Mr. Root's speecb tbe betting in Wall Street in favour of Mr. Hnghes advanced to 4 to 1
(Reuter)

div.head: NORTH POLE EXPEDITION
div.p: COMMANDER PEARY'S RETURN.
Ottawa, November 3. According to advices received at Hopedale (Labrador) the explorer Commarder Peary is returning atter baving reached 87.6' degrees, which is the farthest point yet attained.
(Reuter)

OTTAWA, November 3. Commander Peary's homeward voyage was an incessant battle against ice and storms. There were no deaths or illness, althoogb sometimes the men were starving and compelled to eat their doge. The expedition left New York on the 16th July, 1905.
(Router)

div.head: FRÉNCH POLICY
div.p: NEW MINISTRY'S DECLARATION.
Paris, November 8. The Coonoil of Ministers has approved the Ministerial Declaration, which will be read
on Monday. This Declaration is more ad - vapood than those of all previons Cabinets.

It appoancos numerous projects in the inte rior ; abroad, it intends to maintain the Franco-Russian Alliance and the previous friendshipe forned by France, whieh will continue to follow s policy of rectitude, resting on defensive foroes.
(Havas)

PARIS, November 4. A declaration which M. Clemenceat will read in the Chamber of Deputies on Monday Asserts that the Cabinet intends to maintain tbe Franco Russian Alliance and all the precions frien debips formed by Prance. Prapce will continue to pursue with the Powers the straightforward policy wbich bas enabled her to take one of the first plaors in the world, and wbich she will sopport with her defensive forcer. The Separation Law is to be applied without persecution, but firmly. Nomerous extensive reforms dealing with income tax and old-age pensions are foreshadowed. (Reuter)
AUSTRIA AND ITALY.
PRIENDLY DECLARATIONS,

Rome, November 3. According to a semi-official statement, pabLisbed simultaneously here and in Vienna Baron L xa d'Aehrenthal and Signor Tittoni exchanged friendly declarations resulting in an agreement. They are acting in fall accord n order to render ever more cordial and inti. mate the exoellent relations between the two vernments.
(Reuter)
JAPANESE SPY ARRESTED.
MANILLA, November 3. A Japanese has been arrested wbo is sopposed to be an engineer fficer. He was Liscovered making maps of the railways, rivers, od bridges.
(Reuter)
RUSSIAN SAILORS MUTINY.

VLADIMIR, November 4. A domber of milors who were imprisoned in nnection with the Sveaborg motiny pat their vilers in irons and berated 200 of their comades. Troops, were called by telephone and soppressed the motioy.
(Havas)
"UNION OF RUSSIAN PEOPLE."
ST: TETERSBURG, November 4. Certain members of he lecionary Union of the Rassan Peop'e” bave benn arrested here
(Reuter)
MEDITERRANEAN TIDAL WAVE.
Paris, November 3. The damage done by the storm to the seven ports in the vicinity of Toulon was most Estensive. The latest advies show that many
milies bave been rendered destitate. The Blitary and navalaothorities are endeavouring obtain Government aid for them. (Routery!

div.head: TELEGRAMS.
div.p: ENGLAND'S MUNICIPAL
ELECTIONS
A WARNING TO GOVERNMENT.
MODERATES' UNPARALLELED GAINS.

LONDON, November 3. All the newspapers comment on the surprising results of the municipal elections, indicated by the fact that only two London boroughs retorned Progressive candidater. The Liberal Press, while attributing the detent to lavish expenditure in the past, says that the Moderates made use of Conservative political machinery in the attempt to re-oaptare London. They admit that the pablio dread of Sooialism is induced by the truculent tone of the Labourite speakers.
The Conservative Proes considers the resu't of the election indicative of growing dissatisfaction with the Government, and warna Unionists that the call to arms may come when least expected.
Mr. Balfour, spes king in the City, said that the results sbowed that the country was beginning to see through the platitudinous pretences, by means of which tbe Government obtained office.

Me. Arquitb, gpeaking at Manobester, said that the Government intended, without delay, to endow the Orange River Colony to the fullest extent with self-government. He criticised very strongly the reconstitation of the Education Bill by the House of Lords, and said that the Government would not yield if it could, and could not if it would.
(Router)
GALWAY ELECTION
PIGHTING WITH SHILLELAGHS.

DUBLIN, November 4. Galway election.--- Mr. Stephen Gwynn, Na tionalist candidate, has been elected with 983 voter, in place of Mr. Devlid, retired. Mr. Shawe Taylor, the Devolutiopist candidate, beopred 5!7 votes. Pighting with ebillelagha continoed all day. The police were powerless to restore order
Later.
Bix persons have been removed to hospital. Porty arrests bave been made. (Peuter)
SPANISH SOVEREIGNS AT MALAGA.
VISIT TO BRITISH PLEBT.

MALAGA, November 3. The King and Q een have arrived bere. They were entboiastically received. Prince Loois of Battenberg welcomed them at the station. The town was dressed with British and Spanisb flags.
(Peuter)

The King and Queen of Spaip bave gone to Malaga on a visit to the British Fleet anchored there. It has been currently stated in Court circles that the King, in speaking of the approaching visit, exclaimed:

"Since Philip II. no Spanish King visited Bogland ontil I myself went there, and I not only visited England, but I married an English Pripoeg”, and I believe wben I have done that I can also pay a visit to Gibraltar !"
WIRELESS TELEGRAPHY
CONVENTION
Berlin, November 4. The Wireless Telegraphy Convention bas been signed.
It is understood that the British delegates are Patisfied with the results, and believe that
be Daval interests bave been folly safeguarded
(Reuter)
ANOTHER SPRINGBOK VICTORY.
LONDON, November 3. Rugby Football. The South Africans beat Gloucester by 23 points to pil. (Peuter) 1

div.head: ALEXANDRIA MUNICIPALITY
div.p: The following is the official communication of the agenda of the next meeting of Alex aldria Municipality to be held on the 7th inst:
1° Communications diverses.
90 Question relative à une amende dhe par un fournisseur pour retard apporté dans la fourniture de dalles (Délég. do 25 Sept. 1906).
3° Projet de règlement modificatif, relatif aux déclarations pour les animaux et véhicules (De'égation du 2 Ootobre 1906).
4° Proj:t de règlement tendant so recensement de la taxe de 2 %, chaque 4 années (Délég. 15 Sept., 2 et 16 Octobre 1906).
5o Projet de règlement relatif aux orgues de barbarie (Délég. 16 Ootoby 1906).
6° Demande de crédits :
a) L.B. 69, à régulariser altérien rement, pour fourniture de fourrages au service des pompiers (Délég. 16 Oot. 1906).
b) LB. 250, à régulariser oltérieurement, en dépense, pour la régularisation des sommes à verser par le personnel, au fonds de prévoyance juequ'à la fin de l'exercice (Délég. 16 Oct. 1903)
L. B. 250, oontribution municipale pour égaler le versement de personnel en 1906, à régalariser ultérieurement (Délég. 16 Oot. 1906).
Proposition tendant à porter, à l'avenir, la contribution de la Municipalité à ce fonds, de on montant égalant, sans limite, les versements effectués par le personnel (Délég. 16 Oot. 1906).
c) L.E. 200, à titre sopplémentaire, à régalariser oltérieurement, pour secours aux tamilles d'employés décédés et autres (Délég. 16 Oct. 1906).
d) LE. 3 000, à prélever sur les Badget | Extraordinaire, pour la confection des nouvelles routes (Délég. 16 Oot. 1906).
e) L.E. 300, à prélever sur le Badget Extraordinaire pour l'installation d'ade presse bydraulique à l'Abattoir. (Délég. 23 Oct. 1906).

1) L.E. 830, à prélever sur lebudget extraordidaire, pour la construction de deux obalets de nécessité, à Moharrem Bey et près de Soldiers and Sailors lostitute (Dé ég. da 30 Oct. 1906). 1 ) L.B. 910, à prélever sur le badget extraordinaire pour la confeotion de ohars et aobat de mulets pour le transport da matériel de la Municipalité. (Délég. do 30 Oot. 1906).
7° Approbation du sous-lotissement des ter. raine des quaie, depuis la Poste jusqu'au Vio toria Collège.
Proposition tendant à ne procéder aux estimations des parcelles qu'au fur et à mesure de leur mise en vente.
Ratification des évaluations des lots mis sox enobères (Délég. 23 Oot. 1906).
8° Excédents et emprises : 9° Avis des Comités sur :
a) l'adoption d'un emplacement pour le dérôt des pastèques.
b) la question des lavoirs publics. 1 c) la désignation de l'emplacement destiné A l'éreotion de la fontaine monumentale offerte par 8.E. Nobar Paoha.
10° Proposition de M. Rothaeker tendant à ce que la Municipalité fasse publier dans les Liborpaox pé iodiquement les prix de vente en gros pratiqués à l'Abattoir.
11° Interpellation de M. Rieti sur la question des maisons ou vrières.
SPORT AND PLAY.
FOOTBALL
RAILWAY INSTITUTE. R.A.M.C.

Tbis match was played at Gheziret Badrane! on Friday, 2od instant, before a very good attendance. Neither side were at full strength, but the game was exceedingly fast and brimful of interest from start to finish. The Railway men won the toes and elected to defend the Shoubra goal. The Medicoes' had slightly the best of the opening exchanges, bat Hayes and Windsor were very safe at back.

The Institate forwards soon found their feet, and some very exciting play took place. Hisyes played a brilliant game at left back for the home team, and time after time pulled up the visitors' forwarde. Jast before the interval Captain Bostock got right througb the backs and a score seemed certain. But Stephenson was equal to the occasion, and braght off fine bave. Half time soon arrived with the soore sbeet blank.

The second halt was even faster than the first, and bot for some determined play by both pairs of backs both goals would have been penetrated more than once. The two goalkeepers brooght off several good saves, Stephenson on two oocasions paving when a goal seemed inevitable. As time went on both sides exerted themselves to the utmost to soore, but the deciding goal did not come till the last minute of the game. Newton then soored by slipping the ball past Bevan, who had just managed to keep oat a sbot from Wheal. The game ended a few seconds later in « victory for the Institute by the only goal scored in the match.
PIGEON SHOOTING.
MALTESE VICTORIA SCHOOL.

The pigeon-shooting meeting held on Satarday afternoon for the benefit of the above excellent educational institution, at the RondPoint Shooting Club, kindly let for the cook sion by the proprietors, Messrs. Tedeschi, Pereirs, and Milani, was a great success. The weather was excellent, the attendance ex
ceptionally good, and sport most interesting, over twenty well known sportsmen having competed.

During the intervals the Maltese Phil. barmonio Society ("La Vallette") played select programme under the able bâton of Cav. Ugo Pacciarelli, assisted by Mr. Pipi'd, wbieb 7 was sugh appreciated and applauded.

The Cup offered by the Manufacture Française d'Armes et Cyoles de St. Etienne was won by Mr. Zirani, who obtained the largest number of pigeons during the afternoon. Mr. Zarani also won the silver cognac service, offered by Mr. Alfred Pace, to the competitor who obtained the largest number of prizas, he having succeeded in getting the 2nd, 5th, and 7th prizes. The 1st prize was won by Mr. Galogheropoulo, the 3rd by M. Stipi, the 4th by Mr. Pereira, the 6th by Me. Elias, the 8tb by Mr. Mina, the 9th and 11th by Mr. Pomel, and the 10th and 12th by Mr. Ablitt.

The success of this pleasant and sporting afternoon is mainly due to the sportemen, wbo kindly took part in the meeting, and to the members of the school committee, Mr. Léandre Camilleri, their chairman, being most energetio and successfol, and reodering the gathering, which included a great pomber of ladies, a most pleasant and agreeable afternoon.
CAIRO BRITISH RIFLE CLUB.

The new season commenced on November 1, and already the club has received a large addition of new members, and the ranges are well patronised. Shooting days will, as belote, be Fridays and Saturdays, and to meet the oon venience of some of the members wbo preter ebooting early in the day, the targets are available on Friday morning as well as the afternoon.

The programme for the season will include, besides a number of matobes, competitions for a challenge oop kindly offered to the clab by Mr. A.H. Hooker, a tyro competition for rifle given by the Hon. F. 0. Lipdley, fortaightly sboots for spoons, and the qual sboots for the medals for marksmen wbich Dr. H. Milton has

kindly offered again | The olab is thus looking forward to a busy and interesting season, British subjecte desi rous of becoming members are invited to com municate with the Hon. Secretary, Torf Clab, who will be pleased to give particulars, or to come out to Tourah any Friday afternoon.
The first spoon was won by Mr. Pletober with 77+6=83. A matoh will take place at Tourab Dext Friday afternoon against the 2nd Batt. Ioniskilling Pasiliers.
